author: CardanoDan
title: NFT Key
description: Cardano lacks services that will enable developers to capitalize on the interest in NFTs to drive integration, adoption, and user growth.

assessments.note: If carried out correctly I think this will be one of the go to tools in the NFT space, by bootstrapping this, it will save developers time and resources that can be used effectively elsewhere and as such does aid in addressing the challenge.
This seems like a nice addition to the dev toolkit which will expand the cardano ecosystem.
This would greatly shorten the development time for applications relying on NFT ownership, as well as improve the UX for its users reducing the need for multiple wallet ownership validations.

The proposed project would undoubtedly build a useful tool for the developers that would be in a position to use it. However I believe that the subset of developers that would make use of it would be quite a small percentage, from the overall pool of Cardano developers, and as such the impact of the proposal on the developers experience in the Cardano ecosystem as a whole would be limited.

In my opinion this proposal is within the challenge goal that will enable developers to capitalize on the interest in NFTs to drive integration, adoption, and user growth in Cardano adoption. Furthermore the relation with Cardano blockchain services it is well done specified. The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the stakeholders (in deep detail for users, developers and so on.. ) with examples and use cases

NFT based access control has a number of advantages and opens up a large number of usecases. Gifting of exclusive web accounts, selling games, and as a Membership badge. There is an urgent need to develop such capability in Cardano.

Proposal seems to effectively address the challenge and certainly has engagement from the community on this level. The team certainly appears to be taking a collaborative approach to the project and states it has more in the pipeline.

I have no doubt that that Dan and Chris collectively possess the drive and necessary skills to complete this proposal. I would advise that they do go down the collaborative route and bring outside developers in – to increase their network and provide new opportunities for others.
The proposers seem to have the experience and have thought through the issue involved. They are possibly looking to hire people thus there is a risk there that they don't get the quality they need.
The proposer team background seems to have the relevant experience and knowledge.

I would have liked to see concrete examples of the proposer's past experience and links to previous works. Other than that the plan, budget breakdown, metrics, release timeframes all are very clearly presented and make sense.

The proposal team is completed skilled and very well described on role and specializations, clear documented also other fundamental experiences on cardano blockchain (since 2019 and cardano stake pool operator). In relation to the possible success of the initiative, I think it is well described on the application side but not completely in the business side, so I suggest to integrate information's and business case to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or capital risk

The proposer team is strong and has been involved in the Cardano ecosystem. They are in collaboration with all related stakeholders. There is substantial technical challenges in realizing the proposal but it is possible with the given team composition.

The team appears to have the necessary skillset to set the proposal in motion but I found it difficult to ascertain whether the budget meets the deliverables from the plan presented. I would have liked to see a smaller proposal with suitably adjusted budget that had already established certain aspects such as team building and verification of interest.
The stated experience was a good basis to implement the proposal but what me totally convinced was the technically sould reply to the comments.

I believe this is very feasible from the information provided. If carried out correctly I think this will be one of the go to tools in the NFT space, by bootstrapping this, it will save developers time and resources that can be used effectively elsewhere and as such does aid in addressing the challenge.

I would be interested to know how they are going to manage the database. Is this going to be privately managemd by them? Or is their a distributed option they can provide that provides more long term safety for users and developers relying n it.
Very god proposal that contains all the information I need to asses it.

Given the clear roadmap and set launch date I see no problems in the community being able to keep tabs on the project if funded. The proposers mention that they will begin work prior to voting, allowing for their dedications and  intentions to be verified by the community without risking more than possibly the initial allocation of funds.

The proposer provides a very detailed plan for the implementation with milestones and a defined time horizon; the proposer also adds some information about adoption and delivery of the solution, also the proposer has mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them.. The proposer hasn't considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation

The progress can be monitored by analyzing the code base, and success needs to be measured by the number of services utilizing the NFTKey. It will be possible to do these two in a very reliable manner.

Solid proposal that provides good information without delivering all requirements. There appears to be a small number of points that require further attention to provide an adequate level of certainty to the success of this proposal. Having said that I was impressed with the level of collaboration already achieved and subscribed to by the author. This proposal may simply need to reassess its size and budget allocation to meet all the metric requirements.
Budget, Success-Criteria and Schedule is available and has a good degree of details.

solution: We will provide a service to verify and track ownership of NFTs. Ownership info available via APIs will enable access to gated services.
experience: Two co-proposers (Dan and Chris) possess a combined 30+ years of software R&D, startups, operations, and project management.
